result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Esteban Soler

defendant.name: Soler, Daniel Esteban
defendant.address: 8873 South Oak Park Drive, #16, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt: Court appointed Attorney Joe Domask to represent the Defendant at county expense.

Defendant Daniel Esteban Soler appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel hearing.  Defendant does not qualify for State Public Defender representation.  Court will appoint an attorney for the defendant by the next court date.  Case is adjourned to 11-7-22 at 1:30 pm for status of counsel by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with AES. Court allows children to be exchanged through third party contact. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Daniel Esteban Soler in court. Attorney Madaline Witte in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/23/22 @ 2:30p
